title: Persist Clean Payload After Removals
goal: Guarantee Persist sale only saves the currently visible lines and blocks submission when all lines were deleted.
environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom

specs.title: PersistSkipsRemovedLines
specs.given: An order originally had multiple lines but one or more have been removed prior to saving.
specs.when: The admin clicks Persist sale and the addDoc payload is constructed.
specs.then: The Firestore document contains only the remaining line objects, removed lineIds are excluded, and the inline status list reflects the exact number of saved lines.

specs.title: DisablePersistWhenEmpty
specs.given: All lines have been removed so the draft is empty.
specs.when: The admin views the Persist sale controls.
specs.then: The Persist button is disabled, aria-disabled, and attempting to invoke persist does not call addDoc but surfaces guidance such as “Add at least one line item before saving.”

specs.title: StatusAnnouncesSavedCount
specs.then: The aria-live/persist status region announces the number of lines saved (e.g., “Saved 1 line item”) so admins know how many items reached Firestore.

summary.details: Persist sale now skips removed lines, disables itself when the draft is empty, and announces saved counts through the status list.

changeNotes: Extended the sales line module and harness so confirmed removals update local state, log status entries, and disable/aria-disable Persist sale with guidance until new lines are added.
notes: F11-TP3 builds on removal mechanics from TP1/TP2 by ensuring only remaining lines persist, empty drafts keep the button disabled, and status messaging communicates how many line items were saved.
